articles.title: The Coming Bank-Bitcoin Boom: Americans Want Cryptocurrency From Their Banks - Forbes
articles.description: Banks have to own up to the realization that investing in cryptocurrencies is becoming mainstream. Refusing to play the game is a bad business decision.

articles.title: US fashion brand Abercrombie & Fitch to close Singapore store on May 2 - TODAYonline
articles.description: SINGAPORE — American casual wear brand Abercrombie & Fitch said on Monday (April 19) that it will close its physical Singapore store on May 2. The firm arrived here amid some controversy less than a decade ago.

articles.title: What Is A Climate NDC? - NPR
articles.description: The U.S. is planning to rapidly reduce greenhouse gas emissions. This is America's return to the international climate stage. We break it down for you.

articles.author: RT
articles.title: More than half of all Americans now partially vaccinated, one third fully jabbed up, CDC data shows - RT
articles.description: More than half of all American adults have had at least one dose of a Covid-19 vaccine, and a third have been fully inoculated. Yet some groups are still holding out, and the Biden administration is pressing them to get jabbed.
articles.content: Some 50.4% of Americans aged 18 and over have received at least their first shot, according to figures released by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention on Saturday. 32.5% are fully vaccinat… [+2689 chars]

articles.title: Despite COVID-19 vaccines, Americans in D.C. not feeling celebratory — or charitable - SooToday
articles.description: WASHINGTON — This might make Canadians jealous of their American cousins for the first time in a while: the lineup Friday outside a downtown Washington D.C. Apple Store was longer than at one of the city's largest COVID-19 mass-vaccination sites.
